faq-entry.question: I've found a bug, how do I report it?
faq-entry.answer: The best way is to open a bug report in the sourceforge bug tracking database. Sending a bug report to the mailing list runs the risk that the bug may get lost. Putting it in the bug database guarentees that it won't. Please search the bug database to see if your bug hasn't already been reported before opening a new one.
If you know how to fix the problem then patches are gratefully accepted.

faq-entry.question: HtmlUnit doesn't support feature X. How do I request this feature?
faq-entry.answer: The best way is to open a bug report in the sourceforge bug tracking database. See the answer on bug reporting for why the database is preferred.
If you're willing to write the feature yourself, you can always send us a patch.

faq-entry.question: How do I submit a patch?
faq-entry.answer: Refer to "How to submit a patch"

faq-entry.question: I'm having problems with cookie support
faq-entry.answer: Cookie support is actually implemented in commons-httpclient, a project in active development. The odds are pretty good that whatever cookie problems you're encountering have already been fixed so you might want to try a newer version of their jar file. If that doesn't help then post something to the HtmlUnit mailing list.
